sentence.Network_cn: 他买了一条别致的领带.

sentence.Network_en: He even wore a necktie, a bright bit of ribbon.
sentence.Network_cn: 他甚至还打了条领带, 那是条颜色鲜亮的丝质领带.

sentence.Network_en: You've got some egg on your necktie.
sentence.Network_cn: 你的领带上沾了一点蛋.

entry.def: A necktie is a narrow piece of cloth that someone, usually a man, puts under his shirt collar and ties so that the ends hang down in front.

means.word_mean: 1. neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn (mostly by men) under a collar and tied in knot at the front;

sentences.sentence: "he stood in front of the mirror tightening his necktie"

auth_sentence.content: In the necktie and the crisp shirt, he looked mature and capable.
auth_sentence.res_content: In the necktie and the crisp shirt, he looked mature and capable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In the necktie and the crisp shirt, he looked mature and capable.

auth_sentence.content: Carlesimo, without a jacket or necktie, scans it carefully before he speaks, looking for numbers that pop off the page.

sentences.en: Dress at the party was informal,with no neckties or fancy dresses.
sentences.cn: 晚会上人们的服装很随意,不打领带,也没穿高档的西服。
